Allele.description: The state of a molecule at a `Location`.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).
id.title: Id

label.description: A primary label for the entity.
label.title: Label

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.
description.title: Description

extensions.description: A list of extensions to the entity. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems.
extensions.title: Extensions

mappings.description: A list of mappings to concepts in terminologies or code systems. Each mapping should include a coding and a relation.
mappings.title: Mappings

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.
digest.title: Digest

state.description: An expression of the sequence state
state.title: State

Allele.title: Allele

CisPhasedBlock.description: An ordered set of co-occurring `Variation` on the same molecule.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).
id.title: Id

label.description: A primary label for the entity.
label.title: Label

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.
description.title: Description

extensions.description: A list of extensions to the entity. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems.
extensions.title: Extensions

mappings.description: A list of mappings to concepts in terminologies or code systems. Each mapping should include a coding and a relation.
mappings.title: Mappings

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.
digest.title: Digest

members.description: A list of `Alleles` that are found in-cis on a shared molecule.
members.title: Members

sequenceReference.description: An optional Sequence Reference on which all of the in-cis Alleles are found. When defined, this may be used to implicitly define the `sequenceReference` attribute for each of the CisPhasedBlock member Alleles.

CisPhasedBlock.title: CisPhasedBlock

Code.description: Indicates that the value is taken from a set of controlled strings defined elsewhere. Technically, a code is restricted to a string which has at least one character and no leading or  trailing whitespace, and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents.
Code.title: Code

Coding.description:
A structured representation of a code for a defined concept in a terminology or
code system.

label.description: The human-readable name for the coded concept, as defined by the code system.
label.title: Label

system.description: The terminology/code system that defined the code. May be reported as a free-text name (e.g. 'Sequence Ontology'), but it is preferable to provide a uri/url for the system. When the 'code' is reported as a CURIE, the 'system' should be reported as the uri that the CURIE's prefix expands to (e.g. 'http://purl.obofoundry.org/so.owl/' for the Sequence Ontology).
system.title: System

version.description: Version of the terminology or code system that provided the code.
version.title: Version

code.description: A symbol uniquely identifying the concept, as in a syntax defined by the code system. CURIE format is preferred where possible (e.g. 'SO:0000704' is the CURIE form of the Sequence Ontology code for 'gene').

Coding.title: Coding

ComputedReferenceSequence.description: Define metadata describing a computed reference sequence
ComputedReferenceSequence.title: ComputedReferenceSequence

ConceptMapping.description: A mapping to a concept in a terminology or code system.

coding.description: A structured representation of a code for a defined concept in a terminology or code system.

relation.description: A mapping relation between concepts as defined by the Simple Knowledge Organization System (SKOS).

ConceptMapping.title: ConceptMapping

Expression.description:
Representation of a variation by a specified nomenclature or syntax for a
Variation object. Common examples of expressions for the description of molecular
variation include the HGVS and ISCN nomenclatures.

syntax.description: The syntax used to describe the variation. The value should be one of the supported syntaxes.

value.description: The expression of the variation in the specified syntax. The value should be a valid expression in the specified syntax.
value.title: Value

syntax_version.description: The version of the syntax used to describe the variation. This is particularly important for HGVS expressions, as the syntax has evolved over time.
syntax_version.title: Syntax Version

Expression.title: Expression

Extension.description:
The Extension class provides entities with a means to include additional
attributes that are outside of the specified standard but needed by a given content
provider or system implementer. These extensions are not expected to be natively
understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes
between systems.

name.description: A name for the Extension. Should be indicative of its meaning and/or the type of information it value represents.
name.title: Name

value.description: The value of the Extension - can be any primitive or structured object
value.title: Value

description.description: A description of the meaning or utility of the Extension, to explain the type of information it is meant to hold.
description.title: Description

Extension.title: Extension

IRI.description: An IRI Reference (either an IRI or a relative-reference), according to `RFC3986 section 4.1  <https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-4.1>` and `RFC3987 section 2.1 <https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987#section-2.1>`. MAY be a JSON Pointer as an IRI fragment, as  described by `RFC6901 section 6 <https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6901#section-6>`.
IRI.title: IRI

LengthExpression.description: A sequence expressed only by its length.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).
id.title: Id

label.description: A primary label for the entity.
label.title: Label

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.
description.title: Description

extensions.description: A list of extensions to the entity. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems.
extensions.title: Extensions

mappings.description: A list of mappings to concepts in terminologies or code systems. Each mapping should include a coding and a relation.
mappings.title: Mappings

LengthExpression.title: LengthExpression

mappings.description: A list of mappings to concepts in terminologies or code systems. Each mapping should include a coding and a relation.
mappings.title: Mappings

LiteralSequenceExpression.title: LiteralSequenceExpression

MappedReferenceSequence.description: Define metadata describing a mapped, human reference sequence
MappedReferenceSequence.title: MappedReferenceSequence

Range.description: An inclusive range of values bounded by one or more integers.
Range.title: Range

ReferenceLengthExpression.description: An expression of a length of a sequence from a repeating reference.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the entity.

extensions.title: Extensions

mappings.description: A list of mappings to concepts in terminologies or code systems. Each mapping should include a coding and a relation.

length.description: The number of residues of the expressed sequence.
length.title: Length

sequence.description: the `Sequence` encoded by the Reference Length Expression.

repeatSubunitLength.description: The number of residues of the repeat subunit.
repeatSubunitLength.title: Repeatsubunitlength

ReferenceLengthExpression.title: ReferenceLengthExpression

Relation.description:
A mapping relation between concepts as defined by the Simple Knowledge
Organization System (SKOS).
Relation.title: Relation

ResidueAlphabet.description:
The interpretation of the character codes referred to by the refget accession,
where "aa" specifies an amino acid character set, and "na" specifies a nucleic acid
character set.
ResidueAlphabet.title: ResidueAlphabet

ScoreAnnotation.description:
Provide extra annotations on top of mappings for an individual experiment score.

This model defines what an individual mapping instance looks like in the final JSON.
ScoreAnnotation.title: ScoreAnnotation

SequenceLocation.description: A `Location` defined by an interval on a referenced `Sequence`.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).
id.title: Id

label.description: A primary label for the entity.
label.title: Label

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.
description.title: Description

extensions.description: A list of extensions to the entity. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems.
extensions.title: Extensions

mappings.description: A list of mappings to concepts in terminologies or code systems. Each mapping should include a coding and a relation.
mappings.title: Mappings

digest.description: A sha512t24u digest created using the VRS Computed Identifier algorithm.
digest.title: Digest

sequenceReference.description: A reference to a `Sequence` on which the location is defined.
sequenceReference.title: Sequencereference

start.description: The start coordinate or range of the SequenceLocation. The minimum value of this coordinate or range is 0. MUST represent a coordinate or range less than the value of `end`.
start.title: Start

end.description: The end coordinate or range of the SequenceLocation. The minimum value of this coordinate or range is 0. MUST represent a coordinate or range greater than the value of `start`.
end.title: End

sequence.description: The literal sequence encoded by the `sequenceReference` at these coordinates.

SequenceLocation.title: SequenceLocation

SequenceReference.description: A sequence of nucleic or amino acid character codes.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).
id.title: Id

label.description: A primary label for the entity.
label.title: Label

description.description: A free-text description of the entity.
description.title: Description

extensions.description: A list of extensions to the entity. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems.
extensions.title: Extensions

mappings.description: A list of mappings to concepts in terminologies or code systems. Each mapping should include a coding and a relation.
mappings.title: Mappings

refgetAccession.description: A `GA4GH RefGet <http://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/refget.html>` identifier for the referenced sequence, using the sha512t24u digest.
refgetAccession.title: Refgetaccession

residueAlphabet.description: The interpretation of the character codes referred to by the refget accession, where 'aa' specifies an amino acid character set, and 'na' specifies a nucleic acid character set.

circular.description: A boolean indicating whether the molecule represented by the sequence is circular (true) or linear (false).
circular.title: Circular

SequenceReference.title: SequenceReference

SequenceString.description: A character string of Residues that represents a biological sequence using the conventional sequence order (5'-to-3' for nucleic acid sequences, and amino-to-carboxyl for amino acid sequences). IUPAC ambiguity codes are permitted in Sequence Strings.
SequenceString.title: SequenceString

Syntax.description:
The syntax used to describe the variation. The value should be one of the
supported syntaxes.
Syntax.title: Syntax

TargetSequenceType.description: Define target sequence type. Add more definitions as needed.
TargetSequenceType.title: TargetSequenceType

description: Provide all mapped scores for a scoreset.
title: ScoresetMapping
